> This rule may break some sites, but not often. So we add exclusions for this rule.

This is the primary script for Google Sign-in, so it is not going to be rare at all. See https://developers.google.com/identity/gsi/web/guides/client-library

Example broken sites:
bestbuy.com
patreon.com
reddit.com

issue.title: apple.news
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://apple.news/ATDs_84YNS_KKVZQ_7_Gogg](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapple.news%2FATDs_84YNS_KKVZQ_7_Gogg) ### Comment > Interstitial ads are now showing in virtually ever article on Apple News. My guess is they originate from the URL within the article, and thus are not brokered ads. I do not have 'filter search results/etc' enabled. I have not run an http sniffer yet to see the source for where the ad is originating, but a filter needs to be created to block these ads. There are several per article sometimes. labels.name: A: By Design
labels.description: The issue cannot be resolved due to technical, ethic, or legal reasons

issue.body:
## Information

### Deutsch

Sehr geehrte Benutzerin, sehr geehrter Benutzer, aufgrund von Gesetzen ([z. B. die Gerichtsentscheidung in Karlsruhe, Deutschland im Jahre 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html)) ist es leider nicht möglich diese Paywall (Adblock-Erkennung) zu umgehen. Vielen Dank für Ihr Verständnis.

### English

Dear user, due to a court decision ([eg the court ruling in Karlsruhe, Germany in 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html) ) it is unfortunately not possible to bypass this paywall (adblock detection). Thank you for your understanding.

I will modify it to `(?:pv-cdn\.net|\/dm\/).*\.mpd`, just in case if there wouldn't be `/dm/` but still `aiv-cdn.net` was used, though it will not fix ads if there will be not `/dm/` and `aiv-cdn.net`. If there will be new reports about not blocked ads then we can try to modify it again.

comment.body:
Ok, thanks for clarifying.  I assume you can’t block the tracking resources without also blocking the destination link, or you would have already done it?  I mean going from A (Google ad) to C ([Wine.com](http://wine.com/), or other product site), and skipping B (tracking resources)?  The destination link from the ad can’t be extracted from Google or [doubleclick.net](http://doubleclick.net/) without loading the tracking resources?

Thanks for the tip on [adguard-dns.io](https://adguard-dns.io), but this would end up being much more time-consuming for me than it's worth.  And I have no experience w/ servers, administration, code, etc.

Any word on the [nslookup results](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/174742#issuecomment-2060450587) provided above?


And for these questions on Google search result tracking links, is there an article on AG's site that you could direct me to that explains them?
> * But why doesn’t AG’s tracking blockers ("Block trackers" and "Remove tracking parameters”) do this, as it's essential?
> * And what are the "Block trackers" and "Remove tracking parameters" settings supposed to do, if not strip these links?

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

comment.body:
@bbsixzz `AdGuard for Mac` is an independent program, not limited by Safari's content blocking API.

Could you please test, when DNS filtering disabled, and enabled only AdGuard Base filter?

Also please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window ~90 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

Though this rule is hiding it for me:
`youmath.it#$#body > div:not([class]):not([id]) > div[style^="position: fixed; bottom: 0; width: 100%;"] { display: none !important; }`
@AdamWr could you please check, thank you.

comment.body:
> And I have no experience w/ servers, administration, code, etc.

The dashboard works at a high level and does not require deep technical knowledge. The interface is similar to the ad blocker)

> you can’t block the tracking resources without also blocking the destination link, or you would have already done it?

When possible, we block tracking params. But the links in this case are obfuscated.



> Any word on the [nslookup results](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/174742#issuecomment-2060450587) provided above?

I see same IP on my end - the domain is not blocked by AdGuard. Maybe a problem is more complicated and related to DNS configuration of the site.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

none

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

m.facebook.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

Fanboy's Social Blocking List

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, EasyList Cookie List

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

EasyList Italy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Browser: Firefox mobile 124.2.0

Ublock origin version: 1.57.0

Android version: miui 14.0.13.0.TKOEUVF

Hello. While I scroll Facebook home in the browser often it goes back enough to send to the previous post I've seen. It does the reverse thing if I try to scroll back, jumping forth. Disabling adguard mobile ads filter this behaviour stops.

Looks like its related to ads not being shown but not correctly handled, I could be wrong though.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
